newsitem.title: FRANCE: Technip, Cogema in chemical engineering deal.
newsitem.headline: Technip, Cogema in chemical engineering deal.

text.p: Engineering group Technip and nuclear materials group Cogema said they had reached an agreement to streamline their chemical engineering activities.
This includes a merger of Krebs, a unit of SGN, and the Speichim division of Technip into a joint venture company.
Technip will transfer its 34 percent stake in SGN to Cogema. It already owns the rest.
Technip, in return, will get a 3.5 percent stake in Cogema.
Technip will also have a three-year option to buy Cogema's 12.85 percent stake in Assystem.
Cogema's capital will be increased to allow for Technip's stake. Existing shareholders will get a special dividend of 700 million francs.
